010package imagingbook.pub.color.filters;
011
012import java.util.Arrays;
013
014import imagingbook.lib.filters.GenericFilter2D;
015import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ScalarAccessor;
016
017/**
018 * Ordinary (scalar) median filter for color images implemented
019 * by extending the {@link GenericFilter2D} class.
020 * Color images are filtered individually in all channels.
021 * @author W. Burger
022 * @version 2020/12/28
023 */
024public class ScalarMedianFilter extends GenericFilter2D {
025        
026        public static class Parameters {
027                /** Filter radius */
028                public double radius = 3.0;
029        }
030        
031        final Parameters params;
032        FilterMask mask;
033
034        //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
035        
036        public ScalarMedianFilter() {
037                this(new Parameters());
038        }
039        
040        public ScalarMedianFilter(Parameters params) {
041                this.params = params;
042                this.mask = new FilterMask(params.radius);
043        }
044                
045        //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
046
047        @Override
048        protected float filterScalar(ScalarAccessor source, int u, int v) {
049                final int maskCount = mask.getCount();
050                final float[] p = new float[maskCount];
051                final int medianIndex = maskCount/2;
052                final int maskCenter = mask.getCenter();
053                final int[][] maskArray = mask.getMask();
054                int k = 0;
055                for (int i = 0; i < maskArray.length; i++) {
056                        int ui = u + i - maskCenter;
057                        for (int j = 0; j < maskArray[0].length; j++) {
058                                if (maskArray[i][j] > 0) {
059                                        int vj = v + j - maskCenter;
060                                        p[k] = source.getVal(ui, vj);
061                                        k = k + 1;
062                                }
063                        }
064                }
065                Arrays.sort(p);
066                return p[medianIndex];
067        }
068
069//      @Override

076//              //final float[] pF = new float[3];
077//              final int medianIndex = maskCount/2;
078//              final int maskCenter = mask.getCenter();
079//              final int[][] maskArray = mask.getMask();

081//              for (int i=0; i<maskArray.length; i++) {

084//                              if (maskArray[i][j] > 0) {
085//                                      int vj = v + j - maskCenter;
086//                                      float[] pctr = source.getPix(ui,vj);
087//                                      pR[k] = pctr[0];
088//                                      pG[k] = pctr[1];
089//                                      pB[k] = pctr[2];
090//                                      k = k + 1;
091//                              }
092//                      }
093//              }
094//              Arrays.sort(pR); //pF[0] = pR[medianIndex];
095//              Arrays.sort(pG); //pF[1] = pG[medianIndex];
096//              Arrays.sort(pB); //pF[2] = pB[medianIndex];

098//      }
099}
